alert.note: Alert for Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Smyth. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Laurel Creek, Hurricane Creek, Laurel Springs Creek, East Fork Hopkins Branch, Deans Branch, Locust Cove Creek, Georges Branch, Crewey Branch, Dickey Creek, Middle Fork Holston River, Comers Creek, Hungry Mother Creek, Campbell Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion... Sugar Grove... Adwolf... Thomas Bridge... Hungry Mother State Park... Broadford... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
